results.headline: Review: An Exploration of Race and Class in ‘My Friend Victoria’
results.summary_short: This adaptation of a 2004 Doris Lessing short story follows the life of a young black woman in contemporary Paris.

link.suggested_link_text: Read the New York Times Review of My Friend Victoria

results.headline: Review: After the Terrors of the Blitz Comes ‘A Royal Night Out’
results.summary_short: In this fantasy directed by Julian Jarrold, two princesses escape, incognito, to commune with the joyful masses on the day Word War II ended in Europe.

link.suggested_link_text: Read the New York Times Review of A Royal Night Out

results.headline: Review: ‘Christmas, Again,’ About Holiday Loneliness
results.summary_short: Noel (Kentucker Audley) ventures from upstate New York to Brooklyn to sell Christmas trees, in this film by Charles Poekel.

link.suggested_link_text: Read the New York Times Review of Christmas, Again

results.headline: Review: ‘Hitchcock/Truffaut’ Revisits the Master of Suspense
results.summary_short: This documentary revisits a 1962 conversation between the two directors in a documentary format, with commentary from film luminaries.

link.suggested_link_text: Read the New York Times Review of Hitchcock/Truffaut

results.display_title: Sound of Redemption: The Frank Morgan Story
results.headline: Review: ‘Sound of Redemption’ Traces Frank Morgan’s Route From Jazz Musician to Prisoner and Back
results.summary_short: N.C. Heikin’s documentary is less a thoroughgoing exploration of the saxophonist’s life than a fond tribute.

link.suggested_link_text: Read the New York Times Review of Sound of Redemption: The Frank Morgan Story

results.headline: Review: In ‘Janis: Little Girl Blue,’ Exploring Joplin’s Demons
results.summary_short: The documentary recounts the emotional wounds Janis Joplin sustained growing up as the antithesis of the all-American prom-queen ideal in Texas.

link.suggested_link_text: Read the New York Times Review of Janis: Little Girl Blue

results.headline: Review: ‘The Danish Girl,’ About a Transgender Pioneer
results.summary_short: In Tom Hooper’s new film, Eddie Redmayne and Alicia Vikander portray the 1920s artists Einar and Gerda Wegener as Einar became Lili Elbe.

link.suggested_link_text: Read the New York Times Review of The Danish Girl

results.headline: Review: ‘Iraqi Odyssey’ Shows the Arc of a Family and a Country
results.summary_short: In this documentary, the director Samir reflects on his family’s history and diaspora, by extension, the story of the family’s homeland.

link.suggested_link_text: Read the New York Times Review of Iraqi Odyssey

results.headline: Review: In ‘Tamasha,’ Finding a Path to Love, Show Business and Adulation
results.summary_short: A Bollywood melodrama about a boy, a girl, storytelling and make-believe.

link.suggested_link_text: Read the New York Times Review of Tamasha

results.headline: Review: In ‘Submerged,’ a Limo Ride Hits Rough Waters
results.summary_short: Much of the action is underwater in this thriller starring Jonathan Bennett as a limo-driving bodyguard who must rescue a young woman from kidnappers.

link.suggested_link_text: Read the New York Times Review of Submerged

results.headline: Review: In ‘Killing Them Safely,’ a Debate on the Virtues of Tasers
results.summary_short: This heavily researched documentary by Nick Berardini becomes a dense stew of words and death.

link.suggested_link_text: Read the New York Times Review of Killing Them Safely

results.headline: Review: In ‘Karski & the Lords of Humanity,’ a Holocaust Spy
results.summary_short: This documentary by Slawomir Grunberg focuses on Jan Karski, who reported to the Allies about the Nazi campaign against Polish Jews.

link.suggested_link_text: Read the New York Times Review of Karski & the Lords of Humanity

results.headline: Review: A Whiff of Hidden Toxins in ‘Stink!’
results.summary_short: A strange odor emanating from the fabric of his daughter’s new pajamas leads a filmmaker to investigate the toxic chemicals allowed in consumer goods.

link.suggested_link_text: Read the New York Times Review of Stink!

results.headline: Review: In ‘The Good Dinosaur,’ a Reptile Tends to His Human Pet
results.summary_short: Homo sapiens and giant reptiles co-exist in this animated, alternate universe version of Earth history.

link.suggested_link_text: Read the New York Times Review of The Good Dinosaur

results.headline: Review: In ‘Creed,’ Rocky’s Back, as a Mentor, Not a Fighter
results.summary_short: No. 7 in a series, “Creed” stars Michael B. Jordan as Sylvester Stallone’s protégé. It’s a rarity, A. O. Scott writes: “a terrific boxing movie.”

link.suggested_link_text: Read the New York Times Review of Creed

results.headline: Review: ‘Victor Frankenstein’ Recasts a Tale That Keeps On Giving
results.summary_short: This film, starring James McAvoy and Daniel Radcliffe, recasts a ghoulish story into something of a buddy movie.

link.suggested_link_text: Read the New York Times Review of Victor Frankenstein

results.headline: Review: ‘Very Semi-Serious,’ the World of New Yorker Cartoons
results.summary_short: The stars of Leah Wolchok’s documentary “Very Semi-Serious: A Partially Thorough Portrait of New Yorker Cartoonists” are the cartoons themselves.

link.suggested_link_text: Read the New York Times Review of Very Semi-Serious

results.headline: Review: ‘The Hunger Games: Mockingjay Part 2,’ Katniss’s Final Battle
results.summary_short: Jennifer Lawrence returns in the savior role in the closing chapter of this blockbuster series based on Suzanne Collins’s books.

link.suggested_link_text: Read the New York Times Review of The Hunger Games: Mockingjay, Part 2

results.headline: Review: ‘Mediterranea,’ African Migrants’ Perilous Trek to a Hostile Land
results.summary_short: Risking everything to seek a better life in Europe, two close friends leave West Africa to settle in Italy in Jonas Carpignano’s first feature film.

link.suggested_link_text: Read the New York Times Review of Mediterranea

results.headline: Review: In ‘Mustang,’ Turkish Sisters and Traditions Clash
results.summary_short: This debut feature by Deniz Gamze Ergüven concerns five spirited youngsters and the efforts of their relatives to control them as custom dictates.

link.suggested_link_text: Read the New York Times Review of Mustang
